title: Guarding the Patchwork

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *looking at the discovered fingerprints from before* If so much of me is borrowed... inherited... not originally mine... why do I fight so hard to defend it?
dialogue.context: Puzzled by his fierce protection of borrowed identity

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *shifting into fighter stance* Because even borrowed clothes keep you warm. Even a rented house can be a home.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *touching his patchwork self* But I defend these pieces like they're sacred. I'll fight anyone who questions them, even when I know they're not really mine.

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *revealing the patchwork beneath fighter armor* And then we guard that patchwork with a fierceness that feels holy. Not because it's wholly ours.

dialogue.speaker: Architect
dialogue.text: *voice softening with compassion* But because it's all we've got.

dialogue.speaker: Evan
dialogue.text: *embracing his patchwork* So the fierceness isn't delusion... it's survival. We're not defending authenticity—we're defending the only self we know how to be.

scene_context: Following the intimate rebellion of examining borrowed identity, Evan and the Architect (as fighter) explore why we defend our patchwork selves so fiercely—not from delusion but from necessity.

visual_progression.panel_1: The Architect in fighter stance, defending with holy fierceness, patchwork visible beneath armor
visual_progression.panel_2: Close-up of the patchwork self—borrowed pieces forming a coherent if imperfect whole
